instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A2141 16" MacBook Pro Kernel Panics
threads.message:
Hi, having some major issues with my personal 16" MacBook Pro I use every day. The machine appears to work fine, but once you put it to sleep for a while and try to wake it up it doesn't come back up again but rather quickly spins the fans to max RPM before rebooting and showing th message that the computer was restated because of a problem. Once I am back in the OS I can get this log:

[B]panic(cpu 0 caller 0xffffff7fb5803cf5): GPU Panic: [3:0:0][PPLIB] PowerPlay Failed Resume. TTL Error Message: .

I have already tried a full OS reinstall and restore in DFU via Apple Configurator 2 and an SMC reset...

Anyone ever seen this on one of these 16" machines. Mine is sadly also now out of warranty since November...

threads.title: A2141 16" MacBook Pro Kernel Panics
threads.message:
If you bought it in Germany, should have 2 years warranty.
Talk with Apple...

threads.title: A2141 16" MacBook Pro Kernel Panics
threads.message:
Unlikely they'll do anything as the screen has some liquid damage. It didn't affect the board though. I bought it like that 2nd hand...

Any idea what could be causing this board level?

threads.title: A2141 16" MacBook Pro Kernel Panics
threads.message: Disconnect internal LCD and test the machine on external monitor.

threads.title: A2141 16" MacBook Pro Kernel Panics
threads.message: Well this doesn’t work... Without the internal LCD connected it gets to the apple logo but about half way through it just looses image on the external monitor. Also the lcd is most likely not the fault as I tested it on another machine and it worked fine...

threads.title: A2141 16" MacBook Pro Kernel Panics
threads.message:
Maybe Hall sensors problem, not sure however.
You should test the board in other shell, to be sure.

threads.title: A2141 16" MacBook Pro Kernel Panics
threads.message: So swapped it with another machine. Didn’t help.

threads.title: A2141 16" MacBook Pro Kernel Panics
threads.message: I have successfully moved GPU chips.  I just encountered one of these same problem but have not moved the GPU on this model yet.    We shall see.

threads.title: A2141 16" MacBook Pro Kernel Panics
threads.message: Please let us know if you have any success fixing this issue by replacing the GPU. I have a board with similar kernel panic error.
